//notes: this pouch is highly-modular, with hook-and-loop inserts
the tourniquet pouch is supposed to be a separate item as well
for now, we pretend all pockets are directly attached and not removable
pockets are modelled after an image in source showing the pouch unfolded
description: A compact nylon pouch for first aid items.  There is a separate bottom pocket for a tourniquet.

variants.description: A compact, folding nylon pouch for first aid items, such as bandages.  Two plastic inserts inside can hold a variety of different items, including pill bottles, secured in place by a cord.  There is a separate pocket for a tourniquet, hanging at the bottom of the pouch.  <variant_multicam>

A compact, folding nylon pouch for first aid items, such as bandages.  Two plastic inserts inside can hold a variety of different items, including pill bottles, secured in place by a cord.  There is a separate pocket for a tourniquet, hanging at the bottom of the pouch.  <variant_multicam_black>

A compact, folding nylon pouch for first aid items, such as bandages.  Two plastic inserts inside can hold a variety of different items, including pill bottles, secured in place by a cord.  There is a separate pocket for a tourniquet, hanging at the bottom of the pouch.  <variant_black>

A compact, folding nylon pouch for first aid items, such as bandages.  Two plastic inserts inside can hold a variety of different items, including pill bottles, secured in place by a cord.  There is a separate pocket for a tourniquet, hanging at the bottom of the pouch.  <variant_coyote>

A compact, folding nylon pouch for first aid items, such as bandages.  Two plastic inserts inside can hold a variety of different items, including pill bottles, secured in place by a cord.  There is a separate pocket for a tourniquet, hanging at the bottom of the pouch.  <variant_ranger>

notes: height is assumed to be half of what the pouch is capable of, judging by the photos
there are supposed to be two of these inserts in the pouch

pocket_data.//max_item_length: allows items to slightly exceed size of insert
allows items to slightly exceed size of insert

notes: height is assumed to be half the height of pouch
there are supposed to be two of these inserts in the pouch
negative trim is to allow items to slightly exceed the boundries of the insert itself, like in source

//notes: we currently don't model the straps as separate pocket, as it isn't apparent that this level of sorting would be of benefit to the player
description: A nylon pouch for first aid items.  The straps inside the pouch allow for better sorting of different types of aid.

variants.description: A large nylon pouch for first aid items, such as bandages and tourniquets.  Stretchy nylon straps inside can hold a variety of different items, including pill bottles, secured in place.  <variant_black>

pocket_data.//magazine_well: 20% of available volume inside the pouch (2329 ml)
